009package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
010
011import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
012
013import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.max;
014import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.min;
015
016
017/**
018 * <p>
019 * Implementation of HSV (hue/saturation/value) color space. See Sec. 13.2.3 of [1] for additional details. All
020 * component values are assumed to be in [0,1]. This is a singleton class with no public constructors, use
021 * {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
022 * </p>
023 * <p>
024 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
025 * (2022).
026 * </p>
027 *
028 * @author WB
029 * @version 2022/09/04
030 */
031@SuppressWarnings("serial")
032public class HsvColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
033        
034        private static final HsvColorSpace instance = new HsvColorSpace();
035        
036        public static HsvColorSpace getInstance() {
037                return instance;
038        }
039        
040        private HsvColorSpace() {
041                super(ColorSpace.TYPE_HSV, 3);
042        }
043
044        @Override
045        public float[] fromRGB(float[] rgb) {
046                final float R = rgb[0], G = rgb[1], B = rgb[2]; // R,G,B in [0,1]               
047                final float cHi = max(R, G, B);                                 // max. component value
048                final float cLo = min(R, G, B);                                 // min. component value
049                final float cRng = cHi - cLo;                               // component range
050                
051                // compute value V
052                float V = cHi;
053                float H = 0;
054                float S = 0;
055                
056                // compute saturation S
057                if (cHi > 0)
058                        S = cRng / cHi;
059
060                // compute hue H
061                if (cRng > 0) { // hue is defined only for color pixels
062                        float rr = (cHi - R) / cRng;
063                        float gg = (cHi - G) / cRng;
064                        float bb = (cHi - B) / cRng;
065                        float hh;
066                        if (R == cHi)                   // R is largest component value
067                                hh = bb - gg;
068                        else if (G == cHi)              // G is largest component value
069                                hh = rr - bb + 2;
070                        else                            // B is largest component value
071                                hh = gg - rr + 4;
072                        if (hh < 0)
073                                hh = hh + 6;
074                        H = hh / 6;
075                }
076                return new float[] {H, S, V};
077        }
078        
079        @Override
080        public float[] toRGB(float[] hsv) {
081                final float H = hsv[0], S = hsv[1], V = hsv[2];  // H,S,V in [0,1]
082                final float hh = (6 * H) % 6;                 
083                final int   c1 = (int) hh;                     
084                final float c2 = hh - c1;
085                final float x = (1 - S) * V;
086                final float y = (1 - (S * c2)) * V;
087                final float z = (1 - (S * (1 - c2))) * V;
088                float r = 0, g = 0, b = 0;
089                switch (c1) {
090                        case 0: r = V; g = z; b = x; break;
091                        case 1: r = y; g = V; b = x; break;
092                        case 2: r = x; g = V; b = z; break;
093                        case 3: r = x; g = y; b = V; break;
094                        case 4: r = z; g = x; b = V; break;
095                        case 5: r = V; g = x; b = y; break;
096                        default: // this should not happen
097                }
098                return new float[] {r, g, b};
099        }
100
101        @Override
102        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] colorvalue) {
103                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
104        }
105
106        @Override
107        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] colorvalue) {
108                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
109        }
110        
111        private static final String[] ComponentNames = {"H", "S", "V"};
112        
113        @Override
114        public String getName (int idx) {
115                return ComponentNames[idx];
116        }
117
118}
